title: Yates' new NFL mock draft: Predicting all 32 first-round picks -- and two QB landing spots
content: Which teams might take a quarterback? Could offensive linemen dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the top 32 picks of the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Ex-Jets LB jailed without bond on murder charge
content: A judge on Wednesday kept former Jets first-round draft pick Darron Lee in jail without bond as he faces a first-degree murder charge in the death of his girlfriend.

title: NBA bans Stewart, Bridges, 2 others for brawl
content: The NBA has suspended Detroit's Isaiah Stewart and Jalen Duren and Charlotte's Miles Bridges and Moussa Diabate for their roles in Monday's brawl.

title: Vonn has third leg surgery since Olympic crash
content: Lindsey Vonn had a "successful" third surgery on her broken left leg following her downhill crash at the Olympics.

title: Wasserman stays as LA28 chair after files review
content: Casey Wasserman's job as chairman of the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics organizing committee is safe after the board's executive committee met to discuss his appearance in recently released government files on Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Slovakia stuns Finland to open men's hockey play
content: Juraj Slafkovsky scored twice to pick up where he left off four years ago as Slovakia pulled off an upset in the first men's hockey game of the Milan Cortina Olympics by beating Finland 4-1.

title: Falcons' DC 'disappointed' by Pearce arrest news
content: Falcons defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich said Wednesday that he was "obviously disappointed" by the news of edge rusher James Pearce Jr.'s arrest.

title: Stolz sets record with 1K-meter speedskating gold
content: U.S. speedskater Jordan Stolz won the first of four potential gold medals, setting an Olympic record Wednesday in the 1,000 meters.

title: üèÜ 2026 NFL predictions: Super Bowl, MVP, more
content: Who will win next season's Super Bowl? Who is set to be the next MVP? We asked NFL experts to make early calls on how 2026 will play out.

title: Who wins the Olympic men's hockey tournament? Intel on all 12 countries
content: The NHL is back at the Olympics! Here are the top players to know, each team's medal chances and schedule, and much more.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the men's hockey tournament
content: Just tuning in to hockey again for the first time in a long time? Get caught up here with all the key intel.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Speedskating gold for Stolz and more
content: On Wednesday at the Winter Olympics, Chloe Kim nailed her debut in Milano Cortina while Evan Bates and Madison Chock skate for gold in ice dance free dance.

content: From prospects with big expectations to All-Stars returning from injury, here's who we're paying attention to.

content: All this might be legal, but at some point perception defines reality and optics overwhelm everything.

content: It's time for the push to the NBA Finals. Here's how we see the Eastern Conference and what we're watching.

content: Three ranked upsets lead to big moves in the ACC, Big 12 and Big Ten as the mid-majors get another lock.

title: USA vs. the World: men's college basketball edition
content: The college basketball version of the new NBA All-Star format features elite talent, including 11 freshmen.

title: Men's Bracketology: Who's a lock and who's on the bubble?
content: Right now, it's about looking beyond UNC's numbers and taking into account the context that has the Tar Heels as a 4-seed.

title: Women's Bracketology: Bubble trouble for the ACC?
content: The ACC and Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

title: Power Rankings: A big week for the top of the Big 12
content: Baylor, up five spots in our rankings, is once again atop the Big 12, with WVU, Texas Tech and TCU not far behind.

title: Premier League's 50 worst transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: All right: We've covered the best deals in PL history, but what makes a bad deal? Whatever the reasons behind them, here are the 50 worst since the league began in 1992.

title: How to bet the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am: Will Chris Gotterup stay hot?
content: The next stop on the PGA Tour season brings us to Pebble Beach, where looks can be deceiving as far as course difficulty goes.

title: How WNBA's expansion Tempo are working to become 'Canada's team' and unify country
content: The Carter effect helped popularize the NBA in Canada. The Tempo hope to similarly supercharge women's basketball.

title: Topps' 75th anniversary set gives fans a chance to pull iconic baseball cards
content: For the 75th anniversary, a panel of executives, journalists and collectors selected the 75 best Topps cards of all time and inserted corresponding redemption cards into their latest release.

title: Myles Garrett on hand to support girlfriend Chloe Kim's Olympic gold medal chase
content: Garrett and Kim had a hilarious debate over which of them was more dominant in their respective sport.

title: 10 teams, 12 quarterbacks, no great options: Sorting the lackluster NFL quarterback market
content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

title: Super Bowl runner-up rings: What NFL players really think
content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: ESPN's first points-league mock draft for 2026
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2026, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

title: News or noise: Three fantasy-relevant hitters to have hand surgery
content: Eric Karabell keeps tabs on the baseball world and tells you what is relevant to fantasy baseball managers.

title: Naumov dedicates Olympic debut to late parents
content: U.S. figure skater Maxim Naumov carried the memory of his late parents with him to the Olympics on Tuesday night, delivering an emotional, heartfelt short program at the Milan Cortina Games that fulfilled a dream they had long shared together.

title: Brandon Figueroa rises after upset win over Nick Ball
content: Brandon Figueroa stopped Nick Ball in round 12 to claim the WBA featherweight championship and climb in the rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Six players whose fantasy value has improved most since the NBA trade deadline
content: A closer look at the players who benefited most from the moves made leading up to last week's NBA trade deadline.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Salah's agent in Al Ittihad talks as star open to Liverpool exit
content: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah has given his agent the green light to open talks with Saudi Pro League club Al Ittihad, Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Dawson's Creek Star James Van Der Beek Dies At 48
content: James Van Der Beek, a heartthrob who starred in coming-of-age dramas at the dawn of the new millennium, shooting to fame playing the titular character in "Dawson's Creek" and in later years mocking his own hunky persona, has died. He was 48.

title: Will Remove Illegal Bangladeshi Hawkers From City Footpaths: Mumbai Mayor
content: Newly anointed Mumbai Mayor Ritu Tawde on Wednesday said removing illegal Bangladeshi hawkers who have encroached upon footpaths, strengthening healthcare, and improving solid waste management will be her key focus areas.

title: Minor Jailed, Misses Board Exams, Administration Says He Was Freed On Time
content: A 17-year-old student in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol missed his Class 12 English board exam on Tuesday after being jailed as an adult. Satyam Prajapati, a Congress worker, claims he was released only hours before the test began.

title: Trump Says "Insisted" To Netanyahu That Iran Talks Continue
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday he told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a meeting at the White House that nuclear talks with Iran must continue.

title: Cops Recover Phone Father Sold Before Suicide Of 3 Daughters In Ghaziabad
content: Police here have recovered a mobile phone that the father of the three sisters, who died by suicide in Ghaziabad, sold to a shopkeeper a fortnight before the horrific incident and sent it for forensic examination, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Delhi Civic Body Removes 380 Unauthorised Banners Ahead Of AI Impact Summit
content: Ahead of the India AI-Impact Summit 2026, the MCD has removed nearly 380 unauthorised banners, hoardings and pole kiosks from several locations as part of an ongoing drive of the corporation to clear public spaces of illegal advertisements

title: Probe Agency ED Summons Amarinder Singh, Son In Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned former Punjab chief minister Capt Amarinder Singh and his son Raninder Singh for questioning in connection with a Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) violation case.

title: "Blackout Hours" And More Tools In OpenAI's Teen Safety Blueprint For India
content: Asserting that access to safe and trustworthy artificial intelligence is a fundamental right for the first generation coming of age in the "Intelligence Age", OpenAI on Wednesday unveiled a dedicated safety blueprint for Indian teenagers.

title: Video: Bengaluru SUV Driver Tries To Run Man Over, Drives With Him On Bonnet
content: Things escalated sharply from there, with the SUV driver trying to run the man over and then driving off at high speed with him on the bonnet.

title: On Rahul Gandhi's "Sold Bharat Mata" Charge, N Sitharaman's Sharm el Sheikh Jab
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman launched a blistering attack on Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi today over his "sold Bharat Mata" remark.

title: Man Says He Was In Driving Seat In Kanpur Lamborghini Crash, Court Rejects
content: Mohan, the alleged designated driver of the luxury sports car, said he lost control of the vehicle when Shivam, who was on the adjacent seat, suffered a sudden seizure.

title: "No Information": Mexican President On US' Cartel Drone Incursion Claim
content: Mexico's president said Wednesday that her government was investigating the US shutdown of a border airport, which US officials linked to a Mexican cartel drone breach of US airspace.

title: Wait For Aviation Body To Finish Ajit Pawar Crash Probe: Devendra Fadnavis
content: Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said a crucial probe by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation is underway into the plane crash that killed Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, and urged that conclusions be drawn only after the investigation ends.

title: Maharashtra Cop Kills Wife's Lover, Drives 191 Km To Dispose Body, Arrested
content: A police constable in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai has been accused of murdering his wife's lover and driving 191 Kilometres with the body to dispose of it.

title: Video: MNS Men Rain Slaps On Coaching Centre Staff For 'Insulting' Marathi
content: Taking the law into their own hands yet again, workers from the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) assaulted a staff member of a popular coaching centre in Nashik for allegedly insulting students who were speaking in Marathi.

title: Parliament Budget Session Highlights | Continuing Our Push On Building Infrastructure: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates, Day 11: Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi spoke in the Lok Sabha on geopolitcal conflict, artificial intelligence and a challenge to the US.

title: Poll Body Orders Transfer Of Bengal Officials Posted In Same Area For 3 Years
content: The Election Commission has directed the transfer of senior West Bengal government officials and police officers who have been serving in the same post or district for more than three years, a senior official of the poll body said on Wednesday.

title: Haryana Man Chokes Girlfriend To Death, Then Dies By Suicide: Cops
content: A case of murder followed by suicide has come to light in Sirsa, where a man strangled his girlfriend to death and hanged himself. Police found the bodies of Simran, an orchestra performer, and her boyfriend Sunil in a rented room on Wednesday.

title: Centre Opposes Sonam Wangchuk's Release: What Preventive Detention Rules Say
content: The central government informed the Supreme Court today that it does not want to release climate activist Sonam Wangchuk on health grounds as suggested by the court earlier.

title: Bangladesh elections: How Gen Z uprising cleared the way for the old guards
content: The uprising, sparked by anger over civil service job quotas and fuelled by outrage at police violence, spread rapidly across Dhaka and beyond. ‚Äã‚ÄãAccording to the United Nations, up to 1,400 people were killed, most in the security crackdown ordered by Hasina. ‚Äã‚ÄãThe movement was celebrated globally as a rare, successful Gen Z revolt.

title: 'Stuttering in anger': Cong attacks Puri over Epstein links, poses 6 questions
content: Congress has intensified its criticism of Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri regarding his alleged connections with financier Jeffrey Epstein. Party leader Pawan Khera questioned Puri's interactions, citing an email exchange suggesting Epstein facilitated a meeting with Reid Hoffman. Khera also condemned Puri's remarks on Epstein's conviction, accusing him of trivializing child sexual exploitation and demanding moral clarity from public officials.

title: Govt proposes new defence acquisition procedure aligned with evolving geo-strategic landscape
content: The government has proposed the Defence Acquisition Procedure (DAP)-2026 to align India's defence procurement with evolving geo-strategic needs, economic growth, and technological advancements. This new policy aims to accelerate acquisition, boost domestic manufacturing, and promote jointness and integration within the armed forces.

title: US-Israel meeting: Trump backs Iran talks, warns Tehran citing 'Midnight Hammer'
content: US President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, emphasizing the need for continued negotiations with Iran on a nuclear deal. Trump warned Tehran of severe consequences if talks falter, referencing past US military actions. The leaders also addressed the Gaza conflict and broader Middle East instability, with international calls for restraint amid regional tensions.

title: Google to employees: You can go for our Voluntary Exit plan, if you are not enjoying ‚Ä¶
content: Google is offering voluntary exit packages to its global business organization staff. This move signals a strong push for employees to fully embrace the company's AI-driven future. The offer targets those who may not be aligned with the rapid transformation. This is Google's third such plan in a year, aiming to streamline its workforce.

title: 'Shoe-beating' remark sparks uproar in J&K assembly, BJP demands Omar apology
content: Jammu and Kashmir assembly proceedings were disrupted after Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's remarks about BJP legislators being "shoe-beaten" by Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Opposition members protested and walked out, demanding an apology from Abdullah, who refused, stating his comments targeted the legislators and not individuals.

title: Two boys, aged 13 and 12, in hospital after being stabbed in class at London school
content: Counter-terrorism police are investigating an "American-style" stabbing at Kingsbury High School where two boys, aged 12 and 13, were injured. A 13-year-old former pupil was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder after allegedly climbing over a wall and entering a science lesson. Both injured boys are in serious but stable condition.

title: T20 World Cup: Motie magic sinks England in Mumbai
content: England were bowled out for 166 in 19 overs in reply. They began the chase quickly, but Motie, who mixes left-arm orthodox and wrist spin, dismissed Tom Banton, Jacob Bethell and captain Harry Brook in a spell of 3 for 33.

title: Microsoft's appoints an 'Engineering Quality Head;' here's why that matters
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: Op Sindoor: Didn't strike N-site in Pak's Kirana Hills, says Vice Air Chief
content: The Indian Air Force confirmed targeting terror infrastructure and military installations in Pakistan during Operation Sindoor, explicitly denying any strikes on the Kirana Hills nuclear site. Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Nagesh Kapoor stated that any videos showing attacks on Kirana Hills were not from IAF operations, emphasizing their focus on identified terror and military targets.

title: Sky's the Limit? Suryakumar Yadav sees no ceiling to India's T20 World Cup title defence
content: Captain Suryakumar Yadav led India to a 29-run victory over the USA in their T20 World Cup opener, scoring an unbeaten 84. He emphasized prioritizing team goals and fostering open communication for continued success. India aims to defend their title, with Yadav confident in the team's preparation and ability to go all the way.

title: EU approves Google's $32 billion deal to buy Wiz, says any data acquired is not sensitive
content: Google has secured unconditional EU approval for its $32 billion acquisition of cloud security firm Wiz. The European Commission found no competition concerns, noting Google's smaller market share in cloud infrastructure compared to Amazon and Microsoft. This allows Google to significantly bolster its cybersecurity and cloud computing presence.

title: Erika Kirk addresses backlash as Bad Bunny‚Äôs show outshines TPUSA event
content: Erika Kirk spoke out after Turning Point USA aired its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show honoring her late husband, Charlie Kirk. The broadcast featured a tribute montage and patriotic performances, claiming millions of viewers despite streaming restrictions. While Bad Bunny headlined the official NFL show, the rival event blended politics, grief, and culture into a deeply emotional night.

title: Myles Garrett supports Chloe Kim at Winter Olympics halfpipe
content: NFL star Myles Garrett was seen at the Winter Olympics supporting his girlfriend, Olympic gold medalist Chloe Kim. Garrett watched Kim compete in the snowboard halfpipe, filming and celebrating her runs. This appearance garnered attention online, with fans calling them a sports power couple. Kim is aiming for more Olympic glory, with Garrett providing strong personal support.

title: Darron Lee faces murder charge as prosecutors seek death penalty
content: Former NFL linebacker Darron Lee is now facing serious charges in Tennessee. Police found a woman dead in a home, and investigators identified Lee as a suspect. He has been charged with first-degree murder and tampering with evidence. Prosecutors are seeking the death penalty in this ongoing case. Lee was a first-round draft pick for the New York Jets.

title: Bank strike on February 12: Will banks remain open or closed tomorrow? Why bank unions are striking
content: Bank unions across India have announced a nationwide strike on February 12, protesting the government's new Labour Codes.  Customers face uncertainty as major banks warn of potential operational disruptions, though they are making arrangements for smooth functioning. Unions also advocate for improved work-life balance and a five-day work week.

title: Rajpal Yadav's wife Radha breaks silence on his case: 'Everyone has stood by him'
content: Actor-comedian Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar Jail over cheque-bounce cases totaling nearly ‚Çπ9 crore. His wife, Radha, revealed the film fraternity, including Sonu Sood, Guru Randhawa, and Mika Singh, has rallied behind him, offering financial and moral support. Several prominent industry figures have also reached out, promising assistance.

title: Happy Hug Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes for your special someone
content: The article offers over 75 messages, quotes, and greetings for partners, friends, family, and long-distance loved ones, highlighting hugs as a powerful, simple way to express care and make others feel cherished.

title: Cartel drones, military activity: Chaos at US border town after airspace shut, then reopened
content: The FAA has imposed a 10-day flight restriction over El Paso International Airport and parts of southern New Mexico due to "special security reasons." All flights are grounded, with the federal government warning of potential deadly force against any aircraft violating the restricted airspace. Officials expressed surprise and lack of clear information regarding the unprecedented shutdown.

title: 'Met Epstein 3-4 times': Puri sets record straight after Rahul's charge in Lok Sabha
content: "I want to remind you that today, during the Parliament session, my name was mentioned in the context of some developments elsewhere‚Äîthe Epstein files. I just want to share some information... I want to clarify that these facts are all public," Puri said at a press conference. Puri said the meetings took place before he joined the Union Cabinet in 2017 and are already in the public domain.

title: After batting collapse against USA, former coach urges India 'not to doubt' approach
content: Former coach Sanjay Bangar urged India not to overanalyze their batting struggles against the USA, emphasizing their aggressive style has yielded success. He suggested a slight moderation in approach might be needed, with experienced players like Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav, and Hardik Pandya potentially stabilizing innings.

title: Globemasters & stratotankers: Satellite photos reveal massive US military build-up near Iran
content: Satellite imagery analysis reveals US forces at Qatar's al-Udeid air base have mounted Patriot missiles on mobile launchers, indicating heightened security concerns amid escalating tensions with Iran. This strategic repositioning allows for rapid deployment in response to potential attacks, alongside observed increases in aircraft and military equipment across the region.

title: What happened to Abhishek Sharma on the eve of the USA fixture
content: TimesofIndia.com has learnt that on February 6, after a net session at the Wankhede Stadium, Abhishek ate something in Mumbai that caused an upset stomach. On matchday, his condition worsened, but the batter decided to carry on and play the game.

title: Stranded! How H-1B backlogs are creating cross-border tax compliance risks for professionals
content: From a US perspective, many H-1B holders remain US Tax residents under the substantial presence test despite prolonged physical absence, particularly where the absence is involuntary and the intent to return to USA is clear.

title: 'Family is hopeful': Rajpal Yadav‚Äôs bail hearing tomorrow
content: Rajpal Yadav, currently jailed in a cheque-bounce case, will have his bail hearing on February 12. His manager, Goldie, confirmed industry support from Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan. The family hopes for his release before his niece‚Äôs February 19 wedding, as FWICE also urged members to help.

title: T20 WC: Afghanistan push SA to brink, lose by inches in second Super Over
content: South Africa secured a dramatic victory over Afghanistan in a nail-biting Super Over contest. The match required two tie-breakers after regulation time ended level. Afghanistan fought hard, with Rahmanullah Gurbaz performing exceptionally. However, South Africa ultimately prevailed, advancing to the next stage of the tournament.

title: Ellis, Zampa shine with four-fers as Australia crush Ireland by 67 runs
content: Nathan Ellis spearheaded an under-strength Australia to a dominant 67-run victory over Ireland in their T20 World Cup opener. Ellis's exceptional 4 for 12, coupled with Adam Zampa's 4 for 23, restricted Ireland to 115. Earlier, contributions from Inglis, Green, Renshaw, and Stoinis powered Australia to 182.

title: More US, Venezuelan crude to flow into India? Refiners asked to prioritize these oil grades
content: Practical constraints limit the scale at which Indian refiners can replace existing supplies with oil from the United States or Venezuela. US crude is typically light and sweet, meaning it has lower sulphur content, while many Indian refineries are configured to process medium-grade crude.

title: Bharat bandh on Feb 12: Banks, transport, offices - what will be open and what will shut
content: Over 10 trade and farmers' unions have called for a nationwide Bharat Bandh on February 12, protesting the Centre's 'anti-worker, anti-farmer and pro-corporate policies.' An estimated 30 crore workers are expected to participate, potentially impacting public banking, transport, and government sectors across over 600 districts.

title: American Youtuber mocks Hindus with cow urine slurs at event; angry Indian-Americans walk out
content: During a recent Plano City Council meeting, comedian Alex Stein caused a stir by mocking Hindu customs, specifically cow veneration along with the traditional uses of cow dung and urine. Clad in Indian garb, his satirical commentary prompted several Indian-American attendees to walk out in protest.

title: Steve Smith back in action! Australia call up veteran as Marsh misses T20 WC opener
content: Australia faces a significant setback as captain Mitchell Marsh is ruled out of their T20 World Cup opener against Ireland due to a groin injury. Travis Head will lead the team in his absence. Veteran Steve Smith has been added as cover, ready to step in if needed. This absence impacts Australia's leadership and all-round strength at the tournament's start.

title: 'He's hale & hearty': Govt opposes Wangchuk's release on health grounds
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta made the submission before a bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and PB Varale in response to the Supreme Court‚Äôs earlier query, asking the authorities to consider Wangchuk‚Äôs release on medical grounds over his deteriorating health issue. SC had earlier directed authorities to conduct Wangchuk‚Äôs medical examination by a specialised doctor and file a report before it.

title: Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn and others show support for Rajpal Yadav after he surrenders to Tihar jail
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar jail in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case. Following his emotional plea about financial struggles, several Bollywood personalities, including Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan, have stepped forward to help clear his debt. His manager expressed optimism for his release soon, with a bail hearing scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Fast break: Pair of Kings worth stashing before All-Star break
content: the Detroit Pistons outlasted the Charlotte Hornets in a game defined by chaos and controversy . Isaiah Stewart 's eighth career' penned the latest entry to his r√©sum√©, tying Russell Westbrook for the most home triple-doubles in league history . the Thunder exposed the Los Angeles Lakers' inconsistency when they are without Luka Doncic .

title: What we're most excited to see in 2026: Games, players and more
content: the big Ten has regained its place as the top conference in college football after winning three consecutive national championships . the 2025 college football season culminated with a thrilling College Football Playoff and a national title for undefeated Indiana . it's hard not to look forward to the fall to see what college football does for an encore .

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see
content: the new york Mets capped an offseason overhaul with a trade for ace Freddy Peralta . the defending champion los Angeles Dodgers made the biggest splash when they inked no. 1 free agent Kyle Tucker to a four-year, $240 million deal .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams land heading into All-Star Weekend
content: three teams, made up of american players and international players, go head-to-head in another tournament-style competition . a few new faces have been added to the coveted rosters, including jamal Murray and Chet Holmgren .

title: Reunions, new faces and promotions: Tracking the Power 4 coordinator moves
content: college football's coordinator carousel is often about the next big thing, the name you don't know yet but will soon enough . Chad Morris is back as offensive coordinator at Clemson . he helped engineer the program's rise alongside Dabo Swinney from 2011 to 2014 .

title: Tense meetings, 'petty' gripes and inflated egos: Why Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors had to divorce
content: Shams Charania breaks news that the Warriors are trading Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield to the Hawks in exchange for Kristaps Porzingis . the pair had been eliminated from the NBA Cup two weeks earlier, giving them a rare break in the schedule . they'd won in the previous Sunday night and didn't play again until Friday .

title: Erin Jackson and Brittany Bowe's bond brings them back to the Olympics
content: Brittany Bowe won the 1000-meter race at the Olympic trials in January . the 37-year-old remained the ever-supportive teammate and friend . she won the race by 0.39 seconds, with Bowe's time good enough for second .

title: FanDuel to eliminate credit card deposits March 2
content: draftKings Sportsbook will no longer accept deposits by credit cards beginning march 2 . "this change was made to improve the deposit experience for our customers," the sportsbook says . some sports bettors don't use credit cards because they are responsible for the fees .

title: Tottenham job proved too big for Frank, but changing manager won't fix mess
content: 'FC TV' crew react to the 2-1 defeat to Newcastle united at the st james' stadium in the premier league last summer . the former Brentford manager made it back to the hotel where club officials used it as an example of the step up he had made to Spurs .

title: Europe‚Äôs ‚Äòmost powerful rocket‚Äô set to launch 32 satellites and challenge SpaceX in 2026
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

title: Welcome to the offseason: What you need to know about key dates, biggest questions
content: a third of the NFL could be seeking a new quarterback this offseason . the 2026 draft is projected to be particularly light at the position, and no stars are looming in free agency . teams can begin u.s. games in the coming weeks .

title: Haryana citizens send 11,000 suggestions to govt.‚Äôs AI-based portal for State budget
content: Suggestions concerning local self-governance or municipalities and panchayats topped the list at 750, followed by 450 on infrastructure development, and 200 on education, skill development, and employment

title: Salman Khan‚Äôs brother-in-law Aayush Sharma gets threat email
content: The sender of the email to Aayush Sharma, who is also an actor, claimed he was a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, they said, without providing further details

title: KMRL gets nod to seek ‚Çπ1016-cr. loan for Kochi metro phase-2
content: Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to offer assistance for the project; second phase will be completed in a time-bound manner, says Minister

title: Silk saree production hit in Kancheepuram
content: Since weavers did not get zari, they were unable to weave silk sarees and have not gotten their wages for over two months now

title: Kadalukku Oru Kaditham: when the sea waits for letters
content: The Directorate of Public Libraries has set up an ocean station for marine awareness; members of the public can post letters anonymously, expressing their feelings, in an effort create a connection with nature

title: Karnataka Revenue Department makes plea to High Court
content: The Revenue Department has made a proposal to the Karnataka High Court, urging it to take up auto entry of court orders in RTCs on the lines of revenue courts

title: Karnataka High Court defers cross-examination of witnesses in murder case to prevent exposure of defence strategy
content: In a ruling reinforcing fair trial rights of the accused persons in criminal cases, the Karnataka High Court has directed a trial court to defer cross-examination of a prime witness in a murder case till the examination of remaining witnesses ‚Äòto prevent exposure of the defence strategy that may enable other witnesses to tailor their testimony‚Äô

title: Supreme Court adjourns hearing in case against T.N. CM Stalin‚Äôs 2011 poll win
content: The Madras High Court had dismissed the allegations raised by Saidai Duraisamy for lack of conclusive evidence in 2017

title: Supreme Court agrees to list another plea against Assam CM for alleged hate speeches
content: The petition alleged that Himanta Biswa Sarma had repeatedly made statements that incite discrimination, social and economic boycotts and violence against Bengali-origin Muslims in Assam

title: Over 13 crore disbursed for students under VIT‚Äôs scholarship scheme: Chancellor
content: On the occasion, Deputy Speaker of Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly and chief guest K. Pitchandi distributed scholarships worth ‚Çπ28 lakh to 242 meritorious students

title: APSRTC to induct 750 electric buses in GCC mode; staff union flays move
content: Tenders for civil works at the proposed e-Bus depots are being released and the construction is likely to begin within one and a half months, says official

title: Tribal hamlets atop Jarthankollai hillock in Vellore get first bitumen road
content: DRDA officials say that the new bitumen stretch is laid between Thellai and Jarthankollai villages on the hills at a cost of ‚Çπ14.99 crore

title: Three bridges across Cheyyar river near Chengam, Polur towns inaugurated
content: The new bridges will end a detour of at least 20 kms for residents in surrounding farming villages to reach nearest towns like Polur, Arani, Chengam, and Tiruvannamalai

title: Over 800 Haj pilgrims vaccinated in Vellore, nearby districts
content: The initiative, which will be completed in these districts by Friday, is being done in coordination with the State and district Haj committees

title: A.P. Discoms told to ensure uninterrupted power supply during Sivaratri festival
content: Energy Minister asks officials to carry out preventive maintenance checks of feeders, transformers, and distribution lines to avoid power breakdowns

title: By next academic year, government wants AI to become part of teaching-learning at all levels of education
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan met with leaders of 10 leading start-ups using AI in the ed-tech sector at a roundtable discussion in IIT Delhi, ahead of the government‚Äôs Bharat Bodhan AI Conclave starting December 11

title: Brain-dead engineering student‚Äôs organs give new lease of life to several patients
content: Family consents to donation after accident; heart, liver, kidneys, lungs and corneas transplanted across Vijayawada, Guntur and Hyderabad

title: Tamil Brahmi inscriptions found in Egypt‚Äôs Valley of the Kings shed light on ancient trade links
content: Indian visitors seem to have followed an existing practice of leaving their names inside the tombs, researchers say

title: Praja Arogya Vedika seeks higher health outlay in 2026-27 Budget
content: PAV urges Ministers to raise health allocation to 2.5% of GSDP and provide an additional ‚Çπ20,000 to ‚Çπ25,000 crore, with emphasis on primary care, tribal health and strengthening publicly funded services

title: Ahead of March 31 deadline, Odisha revises surrender and rehabilitation scheme for surrendering Maoists
content: After revision of guideline in November last year that saw reward money going up substantially, 45 LWEs have surrendered before security forces while there are still 40 cadres including a State Committee Member active in Odisha

title: Amid Naravane memoir row, Defence Ministry plans fresh norms
content: The proposed guidelines for serving, retired armed forces personnel, who wish to publish books in future, will spell out the process to be followed before any manuscript is cleared for publication

title: Calling Rafale the ‚Äòhero‚Äô of Operation Sindoor, Vice Chief of Air Staff seeks more fighter planes for IAF
content: IAF looking to induct more new generation multi-role fighter aircraft into its fleet, says Air Marshal Kapoor; Vayu Shakti exercise at Pokhran range this month to showcase IAF‚Äôs air assets and firepower

title: Supreme Court orders completion of AAIB probe into AI-171 flight crash in three weeks
content: Air India Flight 171 crash at the Ahmedabad airport killed 12 crew members and 229 passengers on June 12 last year

title: Vande Mataram to be played before Jana Gana Mana, says Centre to States and government bodies
content: The fresh set of guidelines were uploaded on the MHA‚Äôs website on February 6 but no formal announcement or a statement was issued; it states that whenever the official version, around 3.10 minutes long, is sung or played, the audience shall stand to attention

title: Two separate landmine explosions leave soldier, civilian injured in J&K
content: An anti-personnel landmine went off at forward post Faulad, close to the LoC, in Gulmarg Sector in Baramulla; an older, similar device exploded in Poonch

title: Gunadala Matha annual fete concludes amid huge turnout
content: Solemn Eucharistic celebration marks final day as Bishop calls for equality and leaders assure development of shrine on par with Velankanni

title: Build memorial for Bengal revolutionaries who never wrote mercy petitions: Trinamool Congress MP
content: In the Rajya Sabha, members demanded curbs on Korean mobile games, right to recall elected representatives, and Constitutional status to the National Commission for Minorities. They also discussed the impact of the India-U.S. trade deal on soybean farmers in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Bacteria can talk to each other and are multilingual, says biologist
content: The award winning scientist¬†believes our understanding of bacterial behaviour can help in creating new therapies¬†

title: Sharmila terms Governor‚Äôs Budget address hollow and directionless
content: PCC chief says speech repackaged manifesto, masked 19 months of governance failures and made inflated claims on investments, jobs and welfare schemes

title: Speaker can expunge any unparliamentary language, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: CM apologises for his earlier remarks implying that BJP legislators had been reprimanded by the Union Home Minister, triggering an Opposition protest; CM apologises, but lashes out at LoP for his criticism of NC founder Sheikh Abdullah

title: BMTC to set up EV battery swapping stations at bus terminals across Bengaluru
content: The BMTC has identified multiple locations across the city, including Shantinagar, Domlur TTMC, Malleshwaram, Yelahanka New Town, Nagarbhavi and Vidyaranyapura, with spaces ranging from 120 to 250 sq. ft.

title: Union Minister Hardeep Puri acknowledges Epstein meetings, says Rahul Gandhi indulging in ‚Äòinnuendo, smear campaign‚Äô
content: The Union Minister said his interactions with Epstein had nothing to do with the crimes and that he had apprised Rahul Gandhi by sending a "note" last year

title: Amid heated debate, a light-hearted exchange between Opposition and Chair
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi responded gamely to the Chair of the House, the BJP‚Äôs Jagdambika Pal, who was formerly with the Congress

title: Karnataka introduces online scrutiny to prevent revenue courts from admitting cases beyond their jurisdiction
content: The government has put in place a 15-point online screening measure to prevent revenue courts from overstepping their jurisdiction

title: Curtains go up for VAIGA 2026 fest at Anayara World Market
content: Agriculture Minister underscores need for value addition in agriculture for enhancing incomes and says ryots and farmer collectives need to concentrate on entrepreneurship for making farming profitable

title: A.P. Food Commission member inspects anganwadi centres, issues show-cause notices
content: Lakshmi Reddy Endela directs CDPOs to issue show-cause notices to employees of Medarametla and Bodduvanipalem anganwadi centres

title: Delhi HC seeks production, sales details from Rapsodia in Anupama Dayal copyright suit
content: The Indian designer has alleged unauthorised duplication of her copyrighted works by Argentinian brand Rapsodia

title: Ravi Pillai academic scholarship will pave the way for academic development: CM
content: Pinarayi  urges students to be vigilant against attempts to promote caste-religious enmity and says students should retain their humanity to work for the good of society

title: Parents association hails release of ‚Çπ1,200 crore towards fee reimbursements, scholarships
content: They demand State government to release ‚Çπ7,000 crore in pending dues under Vidya Deeven and Vasathi Deevena schemes

title: Governor‚Äôs address disappointing, no major issue concerning State mentioned: CPI(M)
content: The party State secretary says speech ignored Central dues, Visakhapatnam Steel Plant, Polavaram oustees and ‚Çπ1,500 monthly aid to women; alleges over ‚Çπ15,000 crore additional power burden on consumers

title: Let routine policing work not suffer because of impending elections in Tamil Nadu, cautions Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh sends across the message during the hearing of a case taken up to prevent reckless riding/driving of motor vehicles on public roads

title: RT mission sets a global model of women empowerment in tourism, says Kerala Tourism Minister
content: Minister was speaking after inaugurating a five-day Kerala Responsible Tourism Festival on Kanakakkunnu Palace grounds in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Academics warn of  deepening crisis in higher education sector in India
content: Former IISc Bengaluru Director flags the growing problem of educated unemployment while speaking at the National Research Conference, which concluded in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Beldanga violence case: Every emotional outburst cannot be packaged as affecting economic security, Supreme Court tells NIA
content: Supreme Court orders the NIA to file a status report in the Calcutta High Court in a sealed cover after or during its probe on whether there is prima facie material for a case under the UAPA or not

title: Governor‚Äôs address reflects State‚Äôs progress under NDA: Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav says Budget Session speech outlines recovery from previous regime and highlights reforms in health sector under Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu

title: Alliance should last for at least 15 years to ensure a stable government, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: There are no differences within the NDA, and it is a good sign, he says, and emphasises that continued unity is a must for development of the State

title: People urged to take precautions as temperatures rise
content: DMO warns of sunstroke and dehydration risks; advises limiting outdoor exposure between 11 a.m. and 3 p.m.

title: Kerala Cabinet approves women, elderly policies
content: Women‚Äôs Policy 2026 prioritises women‚Äôs safety, labour rights, and laws in tune with the changing times and also focusses on women in tribal and coastal areas

title: Finance Minister to present State Budget in A.P. Assembly on February 14
content: Agriculture Budget to be tabled on the same day; general discussion on the Budget is scheduled for February 17 and 18

title: Red with hues of saffron? Key reasons for Right turn by Kerala's Left
content: Aastha Jha is a writer at The Times of India, covering politics, business and global affairs. She also writes on social issues, with a focus on policy, governance and their impact on everyday lives. Her work brings together reportage and analysis, tracking developments in India and abroad while examining the broader social and economic currents shaping public discourse. Read More

title: With Pakistan reference, Rahul explains how INDIA bloc would have negotiated with Trump
content: 'you Sold Bharat Mata': Rahul Gandhi's sharp attack in the Lok Sabha . he said that the inDIA bloc would have taken a far firmer stand with the Trump administration . Rahul insisted the deal was poorly negotiated and compromised country's interests .

title: Bangladesh's moment of reckoning: Why India, Pak & China are closely watching Dhaka polls
content: after months of violence, street protests and political upheaval, Bangladesh now faces its moment of reckoning . the unrest left more than 1,000 people dead and dismantled a political order that was entrenched in Dhaka‚Äôs politics for over a decade . on february 12, Bangladesh votes in its first general election since that uprising, a ballot that will test not only the strength of its democracy .
